Hi, I’m Christopher!

I’m an Assistant Professor in the Department of Psychology at the University of Rhode Island.

I obtained my Ph.D. in Quantitative Psychology at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, where I was advised by Dan Bauer.

My research goal is to develop quantitative methods to help understand, predict, and influence human behaviors. I am currently focused on combining psychometrics with deep learning to build probabilistic models for analyzing complex behavioral data such as smartphone and wearable sensor data, social media usage data, and electronic health records.
